body:
Comment 1: 
Spec changed, so now a must.
At the same time should unify the errors. The errors generated by the problems in the
code below happen in too many different places in the compiler.

type T interface {
    F1(i int) (i int)
    F2(i, i int)
    F3() (i, i int)
}

type T1 func(i, i int)
type T2 func(i int) (i int)
type T3 func() (i, i int) 

type R struct { }

func (i *R) F1(i int) {}
func (i *R) F2() (i int) {}
func (i *R) F3(j int) (j int) {}

func F1(i, i int) {}
func F2(i int) (i int) {}
func F3() (i, i int) {}
_Labels changed: added **priority-later**, **go1.1**, removed **priority-triage**, **go1.1maybe**._
